turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Stouffville Spirit.
turn.1: What was the Spirits best season in the 2011-12 season?
turn.2: Although the Hurricanes finished second in the OJHL standings for the 2011-12 OJHL season and finished 1st in the North-Division, the Spirit would still play an outstanding series taking it in seven, being crowned the 2012 OJHL North-Division Champions.
turn.3: Did they win any awards or trophies in that season?
turn.4: The Spirit would then move on to compete for the North-West Conference Title having to face the 2011-12 OJHL season Champion, the Georgetown Raiders.
turn.5: What other games did they win in the season?
turn.6: The Spirit would start off the conference final hard and would finish strong taking their third 2012 playoff series in seven games.
turn.7: Did they have any major losses?
turn.8: Although all-star Spirit forward and NCAA Division 1 committed (Clarkson University) player Christian Finch was injured midway through the Spirit’s third playoff series, the Spirit still managed to take the series in seven, which crowned them the 2012 OJHL North-West Conference Champions.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The Stouffville Spirit would now advance to the 2012 OJHL Frank L. Buckland Cup Playoff Final which would see them face the East-Division and South-East Conference Champions the Whitby Fury, who finished ninth overall in the league and fourth overall in the East-Division at the end of the regular season.
turn.12: The Fury would show up at the Stouffville Arena in Stouffville for game 1 (Stouffville having home ice advantage because they finished the regular season with more points) but the Spirit would defeat the Fury 5-1, giving the Fury their third loss of the playoffs out of their 13 playoff game schedule so far.
